Sequence Information.Target Organism: [Ref.19778562] Gram-positive bacteria :Bacillus subtilis(KCTC 3068)(MIC=4 μM), Staphylococcus epidermidis(KCTC 1917)(MIC=8 μM), Staphylococcus aureus(KCTC 1621)(MIC=4 μM), Staphylococcus aureus (MRSA)(CCARM 3543)(MIC=2 μM);Gram-negative bacteria :Escherichia coli(KCTC 1682)(MIC=16 μM), Pseudomonas aeruginosa(KCTC 1637)(MIC=16 μM), Salmonella typhimurium(KCTC 1926)(MIC=4 μM), Pseudomonas aeruginosa (MDRPA)(CCARM 2095)(MIC=16 μM)
Sequence Information.Hemolytic Activity: [Ref.19778562] MHC>400 [Ref.19778562] MHC>400 μM against human red blood cells
Sequence Information.Cytotoxicity: No cytotoxicity information found in the reference(s) presented
Sequence Information.Structure Description: In sodium phosphate buffer, the CD spectra of Ib-AMP1 and all linear analogs showed a large absorbance in the region of 190–200 nm, indicating a random coil structure. The spectra of Ib-AMP1 and analogs 1, 2, 3, and 4 became significantly more b-turn in 30 mM SDS micelles
Sequence Information.Function: Antibacterial activity against Gram-positive bacteria and Gram-negative bacteria

Literature.Title: Antimicrobial specificity and mechanism of action of disulfide-removed linear analogs of the plant-derived Cys-rich antimicrobial peptide Ib-AMP1
Literature.Author: Peng Wang  , Jeong-Kyu Bang  , Hak Jun Kim  , Jin-Kyoung Kim  , Yangmee Kim , Song Yub Shin
